page.title: 04The hamlet of BASTED
page.content:
Basted is a hamlet of less than 30 houses and a public house called The Plough. It is situated beside the River Bourne, 1.5 km south of Borough Green.
The hamlet is dominated by the large {publishing}works, Butterworths which occupies a riverside site nearby. It provides{employment}for many local people. It used to be a paper mill, using the excellent water of the river in the production of high quality paper. Until fairly recently, printing was also carried on here but this is no longer the case.
